Key Match Events: Denzel Dumfries scored an equalizing header from Cody Gakpo's free-kick on 83 minutes to silence the crowd.
Virgil van Dijk picked up two quick-fire bookings and was duly sent off as the Dutch started to lose their discipline.
Pre-Game Insights: Ronald Koeman’s needed an improvement after the break, and the Oranje responded by increasing the tempo after the break as they looked to force an equaliser.
Post-Match Reflections: The draw leaves Hungary in third in Group A3, some three points behind the Netherlands, who trail Germany by two points at the summit, denting the Oranje’s chances of topping their UNL group for the third time in four editions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Flashscore Man of the Match: Denzel Dumfries (Netherlands)
Others: The Netherlands struck late to rescue a 1-1 draw against Hungary in the UEFA Nations League (UNL) to end a run of nine straight H2H victories in this fixture for Ronald Koeman’s side.
Key Player Performances: Roland Sallai opened the scoring for Hungary with a curling effort from close range after a deep cross from Zsolt Nagy.
Team Performance: Hungary and Netherlands played out a draw.
